item.title: Projection Painting Prototype
item.description: Executive Summary The structure of the canvas, mixing colors right on the canvas, layer after layer and letting the coincidence help is what makes traditional painting so powerful. However, as a nerdophile person I often miss the undo button and the color wheel of the digital world. Luckily, I came across the processing movement turning code into art and vice versa. The perfect base to combine vivid richness of painted structure with the interactive and dynamic power of code.

item.title: Like Converter
item.description: The Like Converter transforms likes earned for a Facebook posting into delicious candy. It is a reward system for social media managers and a source of motivation for your desk. Video: The thing itself is built (like the Twetterhaeuschen) on a raspberry pi, an arduino uno using node.js and firmata. The source code is on github: https://github.com/sektionschef/like_converter

item.title: Die Dübitale Revolution
item.description: Bayrische Großvisionäre haben das Tor zu einer neuen Dimension aufgestoßen. Die “Dübitalanzeige” besteht aus einem Holzbrett, in das durch präzise Bohrungen einzelne Dübel von Hand variabel angeordnet werden können. Je nach Dübelsetzung kann so, eine gewisse geistige Flexibilität vorausgesetzt, eine kurze Botschaft encodiert werden, ohne ein einziges Watt zu verbrauchen. Die “Dübitalanzeige” ist der erste große Schritt Richtung dübitaler Ära. Ob das Pixel tatsächlich dem Düxel Platz machen werden muss, wird sich erst in den nächsten Jahren herauskristallisieren.

item.title: Twetterhäuschen
item.description: The Twetterhäuschen is the world’s first Wetterhäuschen for visualizing the sentiment of a specific topic on twitter. It was built on a raspberry pi, a servo controlled by an arduino uno, using node.js in combination with socket.io. item.title: Animation in the command line - ./animation.sh
item.description: Why After finding out how much one can do with ffmpeg… I thought it would be the perfect tool for creating my abstract stop-motion animation I dreamed of for years. What I wanted to realize was simple: combining scenes of a series of high resolution photographs, including images of paintings and digitally edited material with various lengths, framerates exactly timed to a soundtrack. Ffmpeg is a powerful tool to convert audio and video files (among other things).
